$interpreted: Nikola: You're still here? I did an emergency treatment on your void disease. You need to find another doctor and figure out a way to slow down your symptoms.
Child Hyde: ... Thank you...
Nikola: No need to thank me... how did you contract void disease?
Child Hyde: I was part of a group of orphans who were under the control of bandits. We were forced to mine in Atlas when the void is in the "inhale" position...

Nikola: Children are easy to manipulate. If the time calls for it, they are also easy to sacrifice. The bandits got it all planned out it seems.
However, an accident occurred, I presume?
Child Hyde: The monsters suddenly assaulted us. Everyone died. My right eye was struck by a needle fired by a monster...
Nikola: And that's how you contracted void disease?
Nikola: So this is the cost of our crimes... Back then, I shouldn't have advised the late king to dig up the Dragoneye Gem...
Nikola: You interested in books?
Child Hyde: I do like reading...
Nikola: ......
Nikola: I just moved here. My plan is to open a private school.  I need someone to help me organize the books. Can you do that?
Nikola: I'll say this upfront. If you can't do your job well, I will kick you out immediately. I won't hesitate even if your disease comes back...
Nikola: Speaking of that, what are your void disease symptoms?
Hyde: Arghhhhh... ugh...
Nikola: Hyde, are you alright?
Hyde: I'm fine... But... I saw those things again...
Hyde: Master, perhaps you should return to Kingdom of the Sun; I saw...
Nikola: Shut up! Didn't I tell you to ignore your visions?
Nikola: I don't care whether those scenes you see with your symptoms are future images or not.
Nikola: However, if that's indeed the future, that means it's something that hasn't happened yet. Do not let the illusion of the future restrict your present!
Hyde: But, the previous futures I saw have all been proven true...
Nikola: The future can be changed no matter what. Thinking that you can meddle with everything, that's just your delusion!
Nikola: Even if something happens to Kingdom of the Sun, that has nothing to do with either of us.
Nikola: Today, at the marketplace, I met a girl who's selling wooden marionettes.

Nikola: She said that she knows a doctor who specializes in treating void diseases. You should visit him someday,
and see if he can reduce the severe pain you suffer when your symptoms surface.
Hyde: Understood, Master Nikola.
Bandit: ... All books? Does this household not have a single coin lying around?
Hyde: Who's there!?
Nikola: Forget it; no need to pursue him. Make sure that we didn't lose anything first.
Hyde: Understood... how dare he mess up the bookshelf like this...
Hyde: There's a hidden compartment in the bookshelf? What are these documents inside...?
Hyde: Draco...
Hyde: Master Nikola!?

Nikola: These are research papers I wrote back when I was still working at the capitol. 
This is not something you're allowed to see!
Nikola: Put the books back in place. Once you're done organizing the books, go to bed!
Hyde: Understood, Master Nikola...
